result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher P Merrill

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.  No contact with any of the co-defendants, except for Jacqueline Duncan.

2:31 PM Defendant Christopher P Merrill appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def appears from Burnett County Jail.  No PD has been appointed yet.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG plea to misdemeanor.  Def has requested bond modification, argues in support.  State not objecting to bond modification.  Court converts to sig bond, adds condition- no contact with the co-defendants except for significant other.  WTLPH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
